body.p: logiceditorrolelogic editorThe Logic tab provides a Role Logic Editor. The editor has two main parts: Role Description Logic and Never-Group Roles.

section.title: Role Description Logic
section.p: The classifier has a general form which is common to Reflexive, Transitive, Left-Identity, Right-Identity and Role Composition. Role Description Logic Grammar
The Role Description Logic editor works directly with the classifier general form to provide the user with the full classifier capabilities.
There are two basic steps to creating a role description logic. steps in creating role description logic

For example, to create the following right-identity, direct-substance o has-active-ingredient -> direct-substance Step 1. Right Hand Side. First add the Right Hand Side to the declarations list by selecting the Direct Substance in the taxonomy and then clicking the Declaration List (+) add icon: right-hand side: reflexive

The step 1 will show the right hand side in both the upper RHS (Right Hand Side) list and the Declaration List. The result will also show a reflexive declaration because reflexive, by definition, has an empty left hand side. If we stop here the declaration will simply be reflexive. So, on to the next step.
Step 2. Left Hand Side. Now, with "Has active ingredient" still selected in the taxonomy, click the LHS (Left Hand Side) add icon .
The right identity is now complete.
